definitions.title: coll.
definitions.body: body of forced labourers, task-workers, labour-band or gang, also (late) forced service, task-work, serfdom ( Targum [[מִסָּא]], esp. in phr. [[מַסְּקֵי מִיסִּין]] (implying late and [for BH] false sense 'tribute,' so NH [[מַעֲלֵי מָסִּים]]; √ unknown, prob. loan-wd.; follows anal. of [[ע]]“[[ע]]);—abs. ´[[מ]] 1Ki 5:27 + ; [[לָמַָס]] Jos 17:13 +; [[הַמַָּס]] 2Sa 20:24 +; pl. [[מִסִּים]] Ex 1:11; —

labour-band, labour-gang, body of task-workers for public service, formed by levy upon the people by Sol. [[וַיַּ֫עַל הַמֶּלֶךְ]] [[שׁלֽמׂה מַס מִכָּל־יִשְׂרָאֵל]] 1Ki 5:13, amounting to 30,000 men v:1Ki 5:13; [[אֲשֶׁר הֶעֱלָה]] ´[[הַמּ]] 1Ki 9:15; ´[[וַיַּעֲלֵם שׁ]] [[לְמַס עׂבֵד]] v:1Ki 9:21 and Sol. levied them for a toiling labour-band (cf. Ge 49:15, Jos 16:10) = ´[[לְמַס וַיַּעֲלֵם שׁ]] 2Ch 8:8; appar. instituted, earlier, by David, cf. [[וַאֲדׂרָם עַל־הַמַָּס]] 2Sa 20:24, i.e. had charge of the body of labourers, so 1Ki 4:6, 1Ki 5:28, 1Ki 12:18 = 2Ch 10:18.

definitions.title: 2. a.
definitions.body: of labour-bands, slave-gangs of Isr. in Egypt, only [[שָׂרֵי מִסִּים]] Ex 1:11 (J) gang-overseers.

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: of conquered populations, subject to forced labour: [[יִהְיוּ לְ ְלָמַס וַעֲבָדוְּ]] De 20:11 cf. Ju Jdg 1:30, Jdg 1:33, Jdg 1:35 (v. GFM), Is 31:8, La 1:1; so [[ויהי לְמַס]] [[עׂבֵד]] Jos 16:10 (cf. Ge 49:15, 1Ki 9:21); [[וַיִתְּנוּ אֶת־הַכְּנַעֲנִי]] [[לָמַָס]] Jos 17:13, cf. (´[[וַיָּ֫שֶׂם וגו]]) Ju Jdg 1:28.
in gen.: [[וַיְהִי לְמַס־עׂבֵד]] Ge 49:15 and he (Issachar) became a slaving labour-band (poem in J; cf. Jos 16:10, 1Ki 9:21); cf. [[רְמִיׇּה תִּהְיֶה לָמַָס]] Pr 12:24 (here appar. of individ.)
forced service, serfdom (or poss. (in late passage) tribute = enforced payment, cf. NH, Targum, v. supr.), only of Ahasuerus: ´[[וַיׇּשֶׂם הַמֶּלֶךְ מַס עַל־הָאָרֶץ וגו]] Es 10:1.
